full_text: Bees 2014/KER/230 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE HARUN-UL-RASHID THURSDAY, THE 2ND DAY OF JANUARY 2014/12TH POUSHA, 1935 Cri.MC.No. 60 of 2014 [C.C.NO.636/2009 ON THE FILE OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS - MAGISTRATE COURT-III, PALAKKAD, CRIME NO. 2/2009 OF KOTTAYI POLICE STATION] PETITIONERS/ACCUSED NOS.1 TO 6: 1. GOPINATHAN, AGED 37 YEARS, S/O. THANKAPPAN, 12/1, THANKAMUTHU COLONY, NEAR RAGHAVENDRA KALYANA MANDAPAM, POLLACHI, TAMIL NADU. 2. THANKAPPAN, 12/1, THANKAMUTHU COLONY, NEAR RAGHAVENDRA KALYANA MANDAPAM, POLLACHI, TAMIL NADU. BY ADV. SRILNIREESH MATHEW. Prv. Bees 2014/KER/230 CRL.M.C. NO.60/2014: COMPLAINANTS/STATE & DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031. 2. DHARSANA, AGED 34 YEARS, D/O.DR.M.A.MADHAVAN, DIMPLE, KOTTAYI PALAKKAD-678 572. Ri BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT. S. HYMA. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 02-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Prv. Bees 2014/KER/230 CRL.M.C. NO.60/2014: APPENDIX PETITIONERS' ANNEXURES: ANNEXURE-A: PHOTOCOPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CC.NO.636/2009 PENDING ON THE FILE OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS - MAGISTRATE COURT-III, PALAKKAD. ANNEXURE-B: ORIGINAL OF THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 27.12.2013 SWORN TO BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENTS' ANNEXURES: NIL. HTRUE COPY!// P.A. TO JUDGE. Prv. HARUN-UL-RASHID, J. 2014/KER/230 Cr.M.C. No. 60 of 2014 Dated this the 2 day of January 2014. ORDER Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and respondents. 2. Accused in Crime No.2/2009 of Kottayi Police Station pending as C.C.No.636/2009 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court III, Palakkad are the petitioners. The petition is filed seeking to quash further proceedings against the petitioners in Annexure-A Final Report in Crime No. 2/2009 of Kottayi Police Station. 3. The offences alleged are punishable under Sections 498 A r/w Section 34 of IPC. 4. The learned counsel on both sides submit that the disputes between the parties have been amicably settled and having regard to the resolution of the disputes between the parties, continuance of the criminal prosecution against the petitioners is an avoidable irritant. In view of the settlement arrived at between the parties, the Crl.M.C is disposed of quashing further proceedings against the petitioners in Annexure-A Final Report in Crime No. 2/2009 of Kottayi Police Station. Sd/- HARUN-UL-RASHID, Judge. AL/- True copy P.A to Judge Bloat 2014/KER/230 Crl.M.C. No. :2:
